text: Synthesis, Crystal Structure and Antitumor Activity of Tectochrysin-6-sulfonate

LI Wu-Wu() (李午戊);ZHANG Zun-Ting (张尊听)   
(1) College ofChemistry & Chemical Engineering, Xianyang Normal University, Xianyang 7120o0, China;(2 Key Laboratory of the Ministry of Education for Medicinal Resources and Natural Pharmaceutical Chemistry,   
National Engineering Laboratory for Resource Development ofEndangered Crude Drugs in Northwest of China and School of Chemistry and Chemical Engineering,Shaanxi Normal University, Xi'an 71Oo62, China

ABSTRACTIn order to enhance water-solubilityand biological utilization rate of tectochrysin，sodium 5-hydroxyl-7-methoxyflavone-6-sulfonate (1) was synthesized and its structure was identified on the basis of $\mathrm { ^ { 1 } H }$ NMR,FT-IR and elemental analysis. 5-Hydroxyl-7-methoxyflavone-6-sulfonate was assembled with $\mathrm { { N i ( I I ) } }$ or $\mathbf { M n } ( \mathrm { I I } )$ ， hexaquanickel(II) bis(5-hydroxyl-7-methoxyflavone-6-sulfonate) tetrahydrate (2) and hexaquamanganese $( \mathrm { I I } )$ bis(5-hydroxyl-7-methoxyflavone-6-sulfonate） tetrahydrate (3） were obtained and characterized by IR spectroscopy. The crystal structures of 2 and 3 were determined by X-ray single-crystal diffraction analysis.The results showed that 2 and 3are isomorphous crystals and crystallize in monoclinic crystal system， space group $C 2 / c$ . In 2 and 3, the supramolecular structures are organized into hydrophilic and hydrophobic regions. Hydrophilic regions are generated by $\mathrm { \Gamma _ { O - H \cdots O } }$ hydrogen bonds among sulfonate groups, latticed water molecules and coordinated water molecules. The $\pi { - } \pi$ stacking interactions assemble the flavone skeletons into columns and these columns form hydrophobic regions.The sulfonate groups play an important role as a bridge of the hydrophilic and hydrophobic regions as well as the inorganic and organic components. Three-dimensional networks of 2 and 3 are furnished by extensive array of hydrogen bonds, $\pi { - } \pi$ stacking interactions and electrostatic interactions. The anti-proliferative activities of $\mathbf { 1 } { \sim } 3$ in vitro against human leukemia cells K562 and human lung cancer cells A549 were evaluated by the standard MTT assay.The pharmacological activity results showed that the introduction of sulfonic acid groups enhanced the antitumor activity of tectochrysin.
Keywords: 5-hydroxyl-7-methoxyflavone-6-sulfonate; spectroscopic property; crystal structure; antitumor activity; DOI: 10.14102/j.cnki.0254-5861.2011-1791
1 INTRODUCTION

Tectochrysin (5-hydroxyl-7-methoxyflavone),a naturally wide distributed flavonoid,asone of theeffective components of propolis[1]，had many diferent biological activities such asanti-cancer[2]，anti-oxidant[3]and trypanocidal activityl4].The solubilityof flavonoid is poor and itsbiological utilizationrate is low,so it is necessary to synthesize some water-soluble flavonoid derivatives in order to improve their possible biological activities.The introduction of a sulfonate group into flavonoid molecules can enhance their water-solubility and biological activities[5,6l. We have synthesized some flavonoidsulfonatesl7,8l， especially studied the biological activities of sodium （ $^ { 7 , 4 ^ { \prime } }$ dihydroxyisoflavone $3 ^ { \prime }$ -sulfonate[9] and sodium （20 $4 ^ { \prime }$ -hydroxy-7-methoxyisoflavone $\cdot 3 ^ { \prime }$ -sulfonate[10l. The resultsshowed that the biological activitiesof flavonoidsulfonatesare beter as compared with the corresponding parent flavonoids.In this paper, sodium 5-hydroxyl-7-methoxyflavone-6-sulfonate (1, scheme 1) was synthesized, 5-hydroxyl-7-methoxyflavone-6-sulfonatewasassembled with $\mathrm { { N i ( I I ) } }$ or $\mathbf { M n } ( \mathrm { I I } )$ ，andhexaquanickel(II) bis(5-hydroxyl-7-methoxyflavone-6-sulfonate）tetrahydrate(2, $\mathrm { [ N i ( H _ { 2 } O ) _ { 6 } ] }$ $( \mathbf { C } _ { 1 6 } \mathrm { H } _ { 1 1 } \mathbf { O } _ { 4 } \mathbf { S O } _ { 3 } ) _ { 2 } { \cdot } 4 \mathrm { H } _ { 2 } \mathbf { O } )$ and hexaquamanganese $( \mathrm { I I } )$ （20 bis(5-hydroxyl-7-methoxyflavone-6-sulfonate) tetrahydrate (3, （20 $\mathrm { \small { [ M n ( H _ { 2 } O ) _ { 6 } ] ( C _ { 1 6 } H _ { 1 1 } O _ { 4 } S O _ { 3 } ) _ { 2 } { \cdot } 4 H _ { 2 } O ) } }$ were obtained. The structure of 1 was established on the basis of $\mathrm { ^ { 1 } H }$ NMR, FT-IR and elemental analysis.2 and 3 were characterized by IR spectroscopy. The crystal structures of 2 and 3 were determined by $\mathbf { \boldsymbol { X } }$ -ray single-crystal diffraction analysis.The antitumor activities of 2 and 3 against human leukemia cells K562 and human lung cancer cells A549 were evaluated by the standard MTT assay[1,12].
2 EXPERIMENTAL
2.1Materials and physical measurements

All the chemicals and solvents used for synthesis were of analytical grade available commercially and used without further purification.The sample was dried with 2K-82B vacuum drying oven.The infrared spectrum was recorded on a Nicolet 17OSX FT-IR spectrophotometer with KBr pellets in the $4 0 0 0 { \sim } 5 0 0 ~ \mathrm { c m } ^ { - 1 }$ region. The $\mathrm { ^ { 1 } H }$ NMR Spectrum was recorded on a Bruker AM-300 spectrometer with TMS as internal reference and DMSO $. d _ { 6 }$ as solvent. C and H contents were analyzed using a PE-240O elemental analyzer. The crystal structures were determined with a Bruker Smart-1Ooo CCD diffractometer.
2.2Synthesis of 1

Tectochrysin $( 2 . 0 \ \mathrm { g } )$ was slowly added to concentrated sulfuric acid ( $\mathrm { 1 0 ~ m L }$ ） with stirring. The reaction was maintained at room temperature for 15 hours.Then, it was poured into NaCl saturated aqueous solution $\mathrm { 5 0 ~ m L } )$ and a yellow precipitate appeared. After $^ { 5 \mathrm { h } }$ ,the precipitate was filtered and washed with NaCl saturated aqueous solution until the pH value of the filtrate was 7.The precipitate was recrystallized from an ethanol-water $\mathrm { ( V ; V = }$ 1:1) solution to afford 1. It was dried at $1 0 5 \mathrm { ~ } ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ for $1 0 \mathrm { { h } }$ with vacuum drying oven. Yield $= 7 5 \%$ .IR $( \mathrm { c m } ^ { - 1 }$ ,KBr) $\nu$
2.3Syntheses of 2 and 3

An aqueous solution of $\mathrm { N i } ( \mathrm { N O } _ { 3 } ) _ { 2 } { \cdot } 6 \mathrm { H } _ { 2 } \mathrm { O }$ $( 1 0 \% , 5 \ \mathrm { m L } )$ ） was mixed with aqueous solution of 1 $( 5 \% , 1 0 \ \mathrm { m L } )$ ， obtaining 2 after $2 4 \mathrm { ~ h ~ }$ 、2 was recrystallized from an ethanol-water ( ${ \mathrm { V } } { : } { \mathrm { V } } = 3 { : } 1$ ）solution.Green block crystals suitable for X-ray analysis were obtained by slow evaporation of the solvent for about $5 \mathrm { ~ d ~ }$ at room temperature. Yield $= 8 1 \%$ .IR $( \mathrm { c m } ^ { - 1 }$ ,KBr)v: 3461,1646,1608,1483,1445,1208,1176,1099,1042,898,805,770,678.

The method for synthesis of 3 is similar to that of 2,differing only in replacement of $\mathrm { N i } ( \mathrm { N O } _ { 3 } ) _ { 2 } { \cdot } 6 \mathrm { H } _ { 2 } \mathrm { O }$ with $\mathrm { M n S O _ { 4 } { \cdot } H _ { 2 } O }$ Yield $= 8 5 \%$ .IR $( \mathrm { c m } ^ { - 1 }$ ,KBr)v: 3460,1643,1596,1486,1446,1201,1182,1099,1043,898,811,761, 684.
2.4 $\mathbf { X }$ -ray crystallography of 2 and 3

A single crystal of 2 or 3 was mounted on a Bruker SMART-10O0 CCD diffractometer equipped with a graphite-monochromated MoKα radiation $( \lambda = 0 . 7 1 0 7 3 \mathrm { ~ \AA ~ } )$ for intensity data collection at 296(2) K. The structures were solved by direct methods with SHELXTL software packagel13] and refined by full-matrix least-squares techniques.The non-hydrogen atoms were refined with anisotropic displacement parameters. Allhydrogen atoms were located at the geometrically calculated positionsand refined using a riding model.The final refinement converged to $R = 0 . 0 4 0 7$ ， $w R = 0 . 1 0 7 7$ for 2 and $R = 0 . 0 3 2 2$ ， $w R = 0 . 0 7 1 7$ for 3.Details of crystal data collection and refinement are given in Table1,and the selected bond lengthsand bond angles in Table 2.More details about the crystallographic data have been deposited as supplementary materials.

text: 2.5In vitro anti-proliferative activities
2.5.1 Cell culture

The leukemic cells K562 and human lung cancer cells A549 were incubated with a RPMI-1640 medium. The number of tumor cells is $5 \times 1 0 ^ { 3 }$ cells per hole in 96-well plate, the tumor cells continued to incubate for $2 4 \mathrm { h }$ at 37 $^ \circ \mathrm { C }$ ,and the air in the incubator is humid air with $5 \% \mathrm { C O } _ { 2 }$
2.5.2Antitumor activity evaluation

DMSO (two methyl sulfoxides） solutions of compounds $\mathbf { 1 } { \sim } 3$ were prepared for reserve. When the cells were incubated for $2 4 \mathrm { ~ h ~ }$ ，the solution of each compound was added to each pore of the 96-well plates,and the concentration of each compound was 5,10, 20, 40 and $8 0 ~ \mathrm { \textmu m o l / L }$ , respectively. After incubating for 48 hours,10 $\mu \mathrm { L }$ of $5 \mathrm { \ m g / m L }$ MTT solution was added to each hole. The tumor cells continued to incubate for $^ { 4 \mathrm { h } }$ at $3 7 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ The air in the incubator is humid air with $5 \%$ （20 $\mathrm { C O } _ { 2 }$ ： $1 5 0 ~ \mu \mathrm { L }$ DMSO was added to each hole and the solution was clarified after shaking for $1 0 ~ \mathrm { { m i n } }$ . The absorbance of each pore sample was measured by microplate reader. $\mathrm { I C } _ { 5 0 }$ （204号 was analyzed by IBM-SPSS (19.O) software.
3 RESULTSANDDISCUSSION
3.1Spectroscopic properties for $\mathbf { 1 } { \sim } 3$

In the IR spectra of 1, the broad absorption band at $3 4 6 5 ~ \mathrm { c m ^ { - 1 } }$ is assigned for hydroxyl. The stretching vibration of carbonyl appears as a strong band at $1 6 4 6 ~ \mathrm { { c m } ^ { - 1 } }$ . The bands due to the aromatic system occur near 16O7,1487 and $1 4 4 7 ~ \mathrm { c m ^ { - 1 } }$ . The strong absorption bands at 1095 and $1 0 5 2 ~ \mathrm { c m ^ { - 1 } }$ are correlated to sulfonate group,which is consistent with the literaturel14l.The out-of-plane wagging vibrations for the aromatic system are observed at 899, 870, 771 and $6 8 7 ~ \mathrm { c m ^ { - 1 } }$ . The stretching vibration of $\mathrm { C } { \mathrm { - } } \mathrm { O }$ is shown at 1205 and $1 1 4 4 ~ \mathrm { { c m } ^ { - 1 } }$ as strong band. The IR result proves that the sulfonate group was introduced into the tectochrysin molecule.As to the IR spectrum of 2 and 3,they are similar to that of 1 because they have the same flavone skeleton.

In the $\mathrm { ^ { 1 } H }$ NMR spectra of 1, chemical shift at $1 3 . 1 5 ~ \mathrm { p p m }$ belongs to the proton of hydroxyl (C5-OH),and its chemical shift is higher than the normal value,which is due to the existence of $\mathrm { O - H \cdots O }$ hydrogen bond between oxygen atom from carbonyl $\scriptstyle ( C ( 4 ) = 0 )$ and hydrogen atom from hydroxyl (C(5)-OH). Compared with the $\mathrm { ^ { 1 } H }$ NMR of tectochrysin[15] and chrysin[16],the peak due to the proton of tectochrysin's ring A (C(6)-H) disappears.This change indicates that the sulfonate group was introduced into the C(6) position of ring A.
3.2Description of the molecular structures of 2 and 3

table_caption: Table 2.Selected Bond Lengths $( \mathring \mathbf { A } )$ of 2 and 3

img_caption: Fig.1.Molecular structure of 2(a) and 3 (b),showing the atom-numbering scheme.Displacement ellipsoids are drawn at the $25 \%$ probability level.The dashed lines indicate hydrogen bonds

text: 2 or 3 consists of a metal cation $\mathrm { [ N i ( H _ { 2 } O ) _ { 6 } ] ^ { 2 + } }$ or $\mathrm { { [ M n ( H _ { 2 } O ) _ { 6 } ] ^ { 2 + } } }$ , two 5-hydroxyl-7-methoxyflavone-6-sulfonate anions,six coordinated water molecules and four lattced water molecules.The molecular structures of 2 and 3 are shown in Fig.1. The metal cation $\mathrm { [ N i ( H _ { 2 } O ) _ { 6 } ] ^ { 2 + } }$ or $\mathrm { { [ M n ( H _ { 2 } O ) _ { 6 } ] ^ { 2 + } } }$ , lying on an inversion center, has a slightly distorted octahedral environment and is coordinated by six $\mathrm { ~ o ~ }$ atoms from coordinated water molecules.Four coordinated water molecules lie in the equatorial plane and the other two coordinated water molecules occupy the axial sites. The Ni-O distances (Table 2） are almost the same as the equivalent Ni-O distances in $\mathrm { \Delta [ N i ( H _ { 2 } O ) ] ( C _ { 1 6 } H _ { 1 1 } O _ { 4 } S O _ { 3 } ) _ { 2 } \cdot 1 0 H _ { 2 } O ^ { [ 1 7 ] } }$ . The $\bf { M n - O }$ distances (Table 2) are in agreement with the literature[18]. Bond distances and angles offlavone skeleton agree with those of tectochrysin[19].In the flavone skeleton of2or 3,the benzopyrane ring consists of rings A $\scriptstyle ( \mathbf { C } ( 1 ) \sim \mathbf { C } ( 6 ) )$ and C $( \mathbf { C } ( 3 ) { \sim } \mathbf { C } ( 4 ) / \mathbf { O } ( 5 ) / \mathbf { C } ( 8 ) { \sim } \mathbf { C } ( 1 0 ) )$ . The dihedral angle between rings A and $\mathbf { C }$ is $1 . 9 9 ^ { \circ }$ in 2 and $1 . 8 9 ^ { \circ }$ in 3,and that of the benzopyrane ring and ring B $\left. ( \mathbf { C } ( 1 1 ) { \sim } \mathbf { C } ( 1 6 ) \right)$ is （204号 $1 . 3 9 ^ { \mathrm { o } }$ in 2 and $1 . 4 1 ^ { \circ }$ in 3,similar to the value found in tectochrysin[19]. The flavone skeleton is essentially planar, with the mean deviation from the mean plane being 0.021 $\mathring \mathrm { A }$ for 2 and $0 . 0 2 0 \mathring { \mathrm { A } }$ for 3. The similar S-O distances involving O(9),O(10)and O(11)show that the negative charge is delocalized over the three oxygen atoms in 2 and 3 (Table 2).
3.3Supramolecular interactions in 2 and 3
3.3.1 Hydrogen bonds

Sulfonate groups,coordinated water molecules and latticed water molecules in 2 or 3are linked by O-HO hydrogen bonds (Fig.1).The hydrogen atoms from coordinated water molecules with the oxygen atoms of sulfonate group form $\mathrm { O } ( 3 ) – \mathrm { H } ( 3 \mathrm { C } ) cdots \mathrm { O } ( 1 0 )$ and $\mathrm { O } ( 2 ) { \mathrm { - H } } ( 2 \mathrm { A } ) { \cdot } { \cdot } \cdot \mathrm { O } ( 1 1 )$ hydrogen bonds. One interesting structural feature of 2 or 3 is the formation of a hydrogen bonding chain between sulfonate group and coordinated water molecule, which is mediated by a latticed water molecule. It contains $\mathrm { O } ( 1 3 ) { \mathrm { - H } } ( 1 3 \mathrm { B } ) { \cdot \cdot \cdot } \mathrm { O } ( 1 0 )$ and $\mathrm { O ( 1 ) \mathrm { - } H ( 1 C ) \cdots O ( 1 3 ) . } \mathrm { O } ( 1 0 )$ isinvolved in a three-centred hydrogen bond with H(13B) and ${ \mathrm { H } } ( 3 { \mathrm { C } } )$ ,which includes $\mathrm { O } ( 1 3 ) { \mathrm { - H } } ( 1 3 \mathrm { B } ) { \cdot } { \cdot } \cdot \mathrm { O } ( 1 0 )$ and O(3)-H(3C).\*.O(10). Hydrogen bond $\mathrm { O } ( 3 ) – \mathrm { H } ( 3 \mathbf { B } )  – \cdots \mathrm { O } ( 1 2 )$ exists between coordinated water molecule and latticed water molecule.An independent $\mathrm { O } ( 7 ) { \mathrm { - H } } ( 7 ) { \cdot } { \cdot } \cdot \mathrm { O } ( 6 )$ intramolecular hydrogen bond forms an intramolecular motif S(6)(Fig.1).Besides the hydrogen bonds described above,another six kinds of classic $\mathrm { O - H \cdot \cdot \cdot O }$ hydrogen bonds exist in 2 or 3. Details of the hydrogen bonds and hydrogen bonding geometry are given in Table 3. The extensive array of hydrogen bonds makes this region hydrophilic (Fig. 3).

table_caption: Table 3. Hydrogen Bonding Geometry of 2 and 4 (A,)

text: 3.3.2 $\pmb { \pi } { \pmb { \cdot } } \pmb { \pi }$ Stacking interactions

The flavone skeletons of 2 or 3are arranged in an antiparallelfashion and stacked into columns byπ-π stacking interactions. In 2 (Fig. 2), $\mathrm { C g 1 - C g 2 ^ { \# } }$ is $3 . 5 5 2 \mathring { \mathrm { A } }$ ，and a perpendicular distance ( $\mathrm { C g 1 }$ on ring $2 ^ { \# }$ is $3 . 4 6 1 \mathring { \mathrm { ~ A ~ } }$ ，where （204号 $\mathbf { C g 1 }$ is the centroid of benzopyrone ring of the flavone skeleton at $( x , y , z )$ and $\mathrm { C g 2 ^ { \# } }$ is the centroid of benzene ring of the flavone skeleton at $( 1 - x , - y , - z )$ ： ${ \mathbf { \mathrm { C g 2 - C g 1 ^ { * } } } }$ is $3 . 6 2 2 \mathring { \mathrm { A } }$ , with a perpendicular distance ( $\mathrm { C g } 2$ on ring $1 ^ { * }$ to be $3 . 4 1 9 \mathring { \mathrm { A } }$ ，where $\mathbf { C } \mathbf { g } 2$ is the centroid of benzene ring of the flavone skeleton at $( x , y , z )$ and $C { \bf g } 1 ^ { * }$ is the centroid of benzopyrone ring of the flavone skeleton at $( 1 / 2 - x , 1 / 2 - y , - z )$ ： $\pi \cdot \pi$ stacking interaction of 3 is the same as that in 2. $\mathrm { C g 1 \mathrm { - } C g 2 ^ { \# } }$ is $3 . 5 2 9 \mathring { \mathrm { A } }$ ,and a perpendicular distance ( $\mathrm { C g 1 }$ on ring $2 ^ { \# }$ is $3 . 4 5 0 \mathrm { ~ \AA ~ }$ ${ \bf C } { \bf g } 2 \mathrm { - } { \bf C } { \bf g } 1 ^ { * }$ is $3 . 6 0 8 \mathring { \mathrm { A } }$ and a perpendicular distance ( $\mathrm { C g } 2$ on ring $1 ^ { * }$ is $3 . 4 1 0 \mathring { \mathrm { A } }$ . These values are close to those reported for typical aromatic （204 $\pi { - } \pi$ stacking interactions[20], indicating the presence of $\pi { - } \pi$ stacking interactions in 2 or 3. The $\pi \cdot \pi$ stacking interactions are packed along the [110] direction with flavone skeletons and link flavone skeletons into columns. （204 $\pi { - } \pi$ Stacking interactions make this region hydrophobic (Fig. 3).

Cg1 and $\mathbf { C g 2 }$ are the centroids of benzopyrone and benzene rings, respectively. Symmetry codes: (#) $1 - x , - y , - z ; \left( ^ { \ast } \right) 1 / 2 - x , 1 / 2 - y , - z$ （204

text: 3.4Antitumor activity

Cisplatin was used as the positive control.The anti-proliferative activities in vitro against human leukemia cells K562 and human lung cancer cells A549 were evaluated bythe standard MTT assay,and the inhibitory activityof tumor cell growth was expressed as the $\mathrm { I C } _ { 5 0 }$ (Table 4). The pharmacological activity results showed that compounds $\mathbf { 1 } { \sim } 3$ have anti-proliferative activity against human cancer cells K562 and A549. The antitumor activities of compounds 2and 3are stronger than that of1,which indicated that the introduction of sulfonic acid groups enhanced the antitumor activity of tectochrysin.

Synthesis, Crystal Structure and Antitumor Activity of Tectochrysin-6-sulfonate
LIWu-Wu(李午戊) ZHANG Zun-Ting(张尊听)

Isomorphouscrystalshexaquanickel(II)bis(5-hydroxyl-7-methoxyflavone-6-sulfonate) tetrahydrateandhexaquamanganese(II) bis(5-hydroxyl-7-methoxyflavone-6-sulfonate) tetrahydrate were obtained. The crystal structures of them are organized into alternating hydrophilic and hydrophobic regions.The pharmacological activity results showed that these two compounds have anti-proliferative activity against human cancer cells K562 and A549.
